## Bowtie for mapping

```{bash}
mamba env create --file var_calling.yaml
```


```{bash bowtie2}
READS1="/home/andrei/Data/HeteroR/results/data_filtered/DA63342/Illumina/mutants/DA63342m_1.fq.gz"
READS2="/home/andrei/Data/HeteroR/results/data_filtered/DA63342/Illumina/mutants/DA63342m_2.fq.gz"
REF_FASTA="/home/andrei/Data/HeteroR/results/assemblies_joined/DA63342/assembly.fasta"
# make index first!
# mapping
cd results/variants
conda activate varcalling-env
bowtie2-build $REF_FASTA index
bowtie2 -x index -1 $READS1 -2 $READS2 -S aligned.sam
samtools sort aligned.sam > aligned.bam
bcftools mpileup -f $REF_FASTA aligned.bam | bcftools call -m -v -Ob -o variants.bcf
bcftools index variants.bcf
bcftools query --format "%POS\t%REF\t%ALT\n" variants.bcf
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
